question.title: PostMapping request body shows Null
question.body:
Issue with @RequestBody mapping to null in Spring Boot API

While building an e-commerce application, I encountered a problem with my cart API. The API seems to be working perfectly; however, the @RequestBody annotation is mapping my DTO object to null. I've provided the relevant code snippets below:

@Data
public class AddProductInCartDto {
    private Long userId;
    private Long productId; 
    
}


@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/customer")
@RequiredArgsConstructor
public class CartController {
    private final CartService cartService;
    
    @PostMapping("/cart")
    public ResponseEntity<?> addProductToCart(@RequestBody AddProductInCartDto addProductInCartDto) {
        System.out.println("Received payload: " + addProductInCartDto);
        return ResponseEntity.ok(addProductInCartDto);
//      return cartService.addProductToCart(addProductInCartDto);
    }
}

SpringBoot colsole Output

Received payload: AddProductInCartDto(userId=null, productId=null)

Postman Response

I have explicitly mentioned "application/json" in the header, and I also added consumes = MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON_VALUE in @PostMapping. Interestingly, the GET mapping to the same URL is working fine.

Could anyone please help me identify the reason behind this issue and suggest potential solutions? Any insights or debugging tips would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!
